title: Highest Test totals by each team, full list: Zimbabwe break national record
description: Zimbabwe piled on their highest ever team total in Test cricket against Afghanistan in Bulawayo – how does it compare to other nations' highest scores in the format?
author: Yas Rana
excerpt: Zimbabwe piled on their highest ever team total in Test cricket against Afghanistan in Bulawayo – how does it compare to other nations' highest scores in the format?
text: Zimbabwe piled on their highest ever team total in Test cricket against Afghanistan in Bulawayo – how does it compare to other nations' highest scores in the format? Zimbabwe amassed 586 in their first innings, thanks to hundreds from Sean Williams, Craig Ervine and Brian Bennett, as well as a quickfire 68 from opener Ben Curran on Test debut. Their previous record – 563-9 declared – was achieved in 2001 against West Indies at Harare. On that occasion, a 17-year-old Hamilton Masakadza top-scored with 119, becoming the third-youngest men's Test centurion in the process. Bangladesh's Mohammad Ashraful, later that year in fact, pushed Masakadza down to fourth on that particular list with a century against Sri Lanka. Zimbabwe have not been among the busiest Test nations for some time. Only once since 2005 have they featured in more than five Tests in a year – in 2013. The ongoing Bulawayo Test is just their fourth since the start of 2022, a far cry from their heyday around the turn of the century when it was not unusual for them to participate in between eight to 11 Tests per year. They are one of three teams – alongside Test newbies Afghanistan and Ireland – to have not registered a 600-plus score in Test cricket. Highest Test totals by nation Team Score Opposition Match Sri Lanka 952-9 India Colombo, 1997 England 903-7 Australia The Oval, 1938 West Indies 790-3 Pakistan Kingston, 1958 Pakistan 765-6 Sri Lanka Karachi, 2009 India 759-7 England Chennai, 2016 Australia 758-8 West Indies Kingston, 1955 New Zealand 715-9 Bangladesh Hamilton, 2019 South Africa 682-6 England Lord's, 2003 Bangladesh 638 Sri Lanka Galle, 2013 Zimbabwe 586 Afghanistan Bulawayo, 2024 Afghanistan 545-4 Zimbabwe Abu Dhabi, 2021 Ireland 492 Sri Lanka Galle, 2023 Follow Wisden for all cricket updates, including live scores, match stats, quizzes and more. html:
Zimbabwe piled on their highest ever team total in Test cricket against Afghanistan in Bulawayo – how does it compare to other nations' highest scores in the format?

Zimbabwe amassed 586 in their first innings, thanks to hundreds from Sean Williams, Craig Ervine and Brian Bennett, as well as a quickfire 68 from opener Ben Curran on Test debut.

Their previous record – 563-9 declared – was achieved in 2001 against West Indies at Harare. On that occasion, a 17-year-old Hamilton Masakadza top-scored with 119, becoming the third-youngest men's Test centurion in the process. Bangladesh's Mohammad Ashraful, later that year in fact, pushed Masakadza down to fourth on that particular list with a century against Sri Lanka.

Zimbabwe have not been among the busiest Test nations for some time. Only once since 2005 have they featured in more than five Tests in a year – in 2013. The ongoing Bulawayo Test is just their fourth since the start of 2022, a far cry from their heyday around the turn of the century when it was not unusual for them to participate in between eight to 11 Tests per year.

They are one of three teams – alongside Test newbies Afghanistan and Ireland – to have not registered a 600-plus score in Test cricket.

Highest Test totals by nation

Team Score Opposition Match
Sri Lanka 952-9 India Colombo, 1997
England 903-7 Australia The Oval, 1938
West Indies 790-3 Pakistan Kingston, 1958
Pakistan 765-6 Sri Lanka Karachi, 2009
India 759-7 England Chennai, 2016
Australia 758-8 West Indies Kingston, 1955
New Zealand 715-9 Bangladesh Hamilton, 2019
South Africa 682-6 England Lord's, 2003
Bangladesh 638 Sri Lanka Galle, 2013
Zimbabwe 586 Afghanistan Bulawayo, 2024
Afghanistan 545-4 Zimbabwe Abu Dhabi, 2021
Ireland 492 Sri Lanka Galle, 2023
